# Copilot Instructions for geminivideo

This document provides context and guidelines for GitHub Copilot when working on this repository.

## Project Overview

This is the geminivideo project - a repository for working with video content and AI integration.

## Development Guidelines

### Code Style
- Follow consistent naming conventions
- Keep code readable and maintainable
- Add comments for complex logic
- Follow language-specific best practices

### Testing
- Write tests for new features
- Ensure existing tests pass before submitting changes
- Follow existing test patterns in the codebase

### Build and Validation
- Test your changes locally before submitting
- Ensure all linters pass
- Verify that builds complete successfully

### Documentation
- Update documentation when adding or changing features
- Keep README.md up to date
- Document any configuration changes

## Working with Copilot

### When Making Changes
1. Understand the context of the issue or feature request
2. Make minimal, focused changes
3. Test thoroughly
4. Update relevant documentation
5. Follow existing code patterns and conventions

### Best Practices
- Keep commits focused and atomic
- Write clear commit messages
- Review changes before submitting
- Consider edge cases and error handling
- Maintain backward compatibility when possible

## Repository Structure

This repository is organized to support video processing and AI integration. When adding new features or making changes:
- Maintain the existing directory structure
- Place related files together
- Follow established patterns for new components

## Security Considerations

- Never commit secrets, API keys, or sensitive credentials
- Use environment variables for configuration
- Follow security best practices for file handling and user input
- Review dependencies for known vulnerabilities

## Additional Notes

- This project is in active development
- Check existing issues and PRs before starting new work
- Ask for clarification if requirements are unclear
